entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
Hi @Kartheek ,

the note 3578329 describes which technology components belong to which clean core level. But this not mean that all APIs belonging to this component are recommended to use. Each component typically comes with released APIs (Level-A) or classic APIs (Level-B) but also has some internal APIs which are not for use for custom code. Good example is the ALV. The component is rated as Level-B and it comes with a set of classic APIs described in the cloudification repositories. These are the APIs that you should use to work with ALV in a clean core way. The internal APIs can still be used but are not recommended and therefore belong to Clean Core Level-C. There are other components like for example the application Log that also has released APIs that can be used in ABAP Cloud (Level-A). Hope this helps to understand the idea a bit better. 

Regards,

Thomas.

(Current receivables * Number of days) / Total credit sales during the period.

Total credit sales during the period

entry.title: Re: CDS view: Which annotations do I need for BW extracti...
entry.content:
Hi,

Should you ignore the warnings? No.

Your approach conflicts with the validator rule.

  • For C2 objects ADT only allows a very small set of annotations (intended for OData Remote APIs). Analytical / data-extraction annotations are not allowed on C2, so ADT shows:

    • ANALYTICS.DATACATEGORY is not allowed

    • ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.* is not allowed

    • ABAPCATALOG.VIEWENHANCEMENTCATEGORY is not allowed (DDIC-view annotation; not valid for view entities in general)

For BW/4HANA extraction via ODP/ODQ, your CDS is not a Remote API. You should not set C2. Use Local/Not specified (C1 “Released (local)” is fine), and keep the extraction annotations.

Try below options

  1. Revert API state from C2 to C1 (Released – Local) or leave Not specified.

  2. Keep:
    @analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: { enabled: true, delta.changeDataCapture.automatic: true }
    }

  3. Remove DDIC-only annotations such as @AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory (not valid on view entities).

They indicate the wrong API state and an invalid annotation set for a view entity. After switching away from C2 and removing DDIC-only annotations, the warnings will disappear, and the extractor will be valid for BW/4.

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Proce...
entry.content:
Hi Pavan,

To upload a file, the action project cannot be used directly. Instead, the payload must be created through a custom script and submitted via a REST API call in Task Automation.
The process involves the following steps:

  1. Execute a POST request to obtain the access token.

  2. Perform another POST request to upload the document to the designated schema. The response will include the status, ID, and creation date.

  3. Use the returned ID to execute a GET request in order to retrieve the specific document details.

Sample Payload for uploading the document via POST:

let optionsPayload = {
    documentType: "custom",
    schemaName: "delivery_note_schema",
    headerFields: ["deliveryNoteNumber", "purchaseOrderNumber", "deliveryDate"],
    lineItemFields: ["materialNumber", "quantity", "unitOfMeasure"],
    clientId: "default"
};

let requestOptions = {
    method: "POST",
    url: "Your_URL/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs",
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    metadataType: irpa_core.enums.request.metadataType.formData,
    headers: {
        "Authorization": "Bearer " + access_Token
    },
    metadata: [
        {
            name: "file",
            file: fileObj,
            //type: "image/jpeg"
        },
        {
            name: "options",
            value: JSON.stringify(optionsPayload)
        }
    ],
    timeout: 30000
};

return requestOptions;
 
When passing the document in the fileObj parameter, you can use your local file path.
 
I hope this information is helpful!!
 
Thanks,
Aditi Jain

entry.title: Rule-Based Conformance: A Smart Way to Ensure Process Compliance
entry.content:
What Is Rule-Based Conformance?

Rule-based Conformance focuses on checking business rules the atomic units of process knowledge against real execution data. Instead of modeling every possible path in a process, businesses define the rules that matter (for example, “an invoice must always be approved before payment”). These rules are then validated against event logs to quickly identify violations and improvement opportunities.

Which Problem Does It Address?

Companies across industries face challenges such as:

  • Regulatory compliance: Staying compliant while remaining agile is difficult in environments with frequent policy changes.
  • Complex process models: Detailed models are hard to maintain and often become bottlenecks.
  • Operational inefficiencies: Maintaining large process models consumes time, resources, and budget.
  • Slow decision-making: Traditional approaches require long cycles of modeling and simulation before action can be taken

What Are the Benefits?

With Rule-based Conformance, organizations can achieve:

  • Flexible and precise analysis: Focus only on business rules instead of entire models.
  • Reduced operational overhead: Less dependency on large, static models.
  • Enhanced compliance and performance: Quickly detect violations, track critical business behavior, and use insights to improve processes.
  • Actionable recommendations: Receive concrete pointers to mitigate issues and benchmark performance across business units

Step-by-Step: How to Use Rule-Based Conformance

1. Event Log Selection

    • Start by selecting an event log from your SAP Signavio workspace
    • If no log is available, you can import one from SAP Signavio Process Intelligence or use a demo log

 

2. Business Rule Selection

    • Based on your event log, relevant business rules are recommended.
    • Select the rules you want to check against your process data.

 

3. Conformance Report

  • Total Cases (number of executions)
  • Conforming Cases (those without violations)
  • Violations (number and type of rule breaches)

 

 

4. Variant Analysis

    • Explore process variants – unique sequences of activities – to see where violations occur.
    • Violating activities are highlighted in red. Missing activities are displayed separately.
    • You can filter to show only violating variants, making it easy to focus on problem areas.

 

The Solution Explained

At its core, Rule-based Conformance works with event logs and business rules:

  1. Event logs capture actual process execution data from systems.
  2. Business rules (process atoms) define constraints or objectives that must be respected.
  3. The conformance check evaluates each process instance against the selected rules.
  4. A conformance report highlights where processes meet expectations and where violations occur.
  5. Variant analysis visualizes how violations appear across different execution patterns, helping teams pinpoint root causes.

 

!Try It Yourself!

Rule-based Conformance is currently available as a test version in the SAP Signavio Lab Space. This means every SAP Signavio customer can try it out and explore its potential hands-on before it becomes generally available. It’s a unique opportunity to experiment with rule-based compliance checks and provide feedback that will shape the future of process improvement.

Here you find the guidelines to activate an app in the SAP Signavio Lab Space

Conclusion

Rule-based Conformance empowers businesses to simplify compliance checks, reduce overhead, and accelerate decision-making. By focusing on business rules instead of rigid models, organizations gain agility while maintaining full control over compliance and performance.

This is not just about conformance it’s about making process improvement more actionable, scalable, and intelligent.

entry.title: Batch Split Valuation in Product Cost Controlling and Margin Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog will illustrate how Cloud ERP standard features and scope items can handle customer’s product profitability reporting requirements based on product batches. Product cost controlling aspect of split valuation will be our focus and specifically, below scope items are relevant for the blog:

  • Event-Based Production Cost Posting(3F0)
  • Actual costing (33Q)
  • Margin Analysis (J55)

Business requirements

The customer would like to view profitability based on a specific product batch. The revenue for the product is the same cross batches, but the costs may vary for different batches. From management accounting point of view, the “cost objects” here is the combination of products and their batches.

 

Meeting the requirements

SAP Cloud ERP standard features can handle such business requirements. Split valuation based on batches needs to be activated( please refer to blog Split Valuation in Inventory Management on SAP S/4... - SAP Community and its references for more details about split valuation).

With the support of batch split valuation in production accounting (please refer to Split Valuation - Production Scenarios - Product Cost by Order - Production Accounting) Production variances can be posted to the product batches upon goods receipt from the manufacturing orders.

Let’s demonstrate the processes  with some testing screenshots.

Here, two production orders are created and upon goods receipts, production variances are settled. 

Variances with different categories (SLA Line-Item types) are posted to EO Profitability Segment with Inventory Valuation Type attribute. (only one production order is shown in the screenshots)

Next, two sales orders are created for the same product with plans on delivering two different batches (Inventory Valuation Types) respectively.

With delivery orders created based on the sales orders, post goods issues are performed based on product batches. Here, in the accounting document, the cost of goods sold is with Inventory Valuation Type filled (only one sales order process is shown in the screenshots)

Afterwards, with billing performed, revenue is posted with the product batch as additional dimension.

In Trial Balance app, the profitability can be seen for the product and inventory valuation types, albeit the costs of goods sold at this stage are based on standard costs and they are the same for both valuation types. (Alternatively, other Fiori apps can also be used such as Sales Orders - Actuals, Market Segments – Actuals, Product Profitability with Production Variances if the Inventory Valuation Type field is enabled through Data Source Extensions)

During period end, the actual costing run process  will distribute variances proportionally among inventory, work in process, and consumption with the granularity of valuation types and materials. As can be seen, valuation type is available in Material Price Analysis, therefore the “cost object” here is the combination of material and valuation type(batch) and they have different actual prices.

s

(Thanks to @GraceZou  for doing the testing for this part and please refer to her blog Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP - SAP Community for Actual Costing business processes)

The previous posted costs of goods sold for the batches(Inventory Valuation Type) will get revaluated to reflect the actual costs for the batches. Together with posted revenues, the profitabilities for the product batches can be arrived at.

From margin analysis side, Inventory Valuation Type will be available in Product Profitability Review Booklet In the upcoming release.

Summary

This blog omits split valuation master data set-up, production planning, sales and distribution aspect of process and screenshots, rather, it focuses on Inventory Valuation Type on accounting documents for the business processes with regards to production accounting, actual costing settlement and revaluation, and profitability reports.

Feel free to leave comments or post questions and explore other content and blogs in the community.

entry.title: Re: How to speed up depreciation for an asset's rest life
entry.content:
Hello @Dylan2 

Thank you for your question.

The Depreciation Key & Asset Master Data references will provide details.

However, to summarise, in public cloud your requirement is supported through the intervals in the asset master. The issued about depreciation you described comes from how the interval and the useful life settings are interpreted.

The reason that happens is because when you create a new interval and set the useful life to a range of 5 periods, the system then interprets it as the entire remaining net book value must be depreciated across the new life starting at the new interval start date. So, if the start date of the new interval does not align with the next depreciation period or if the remaining life is misaligned with the Depreciation Key logic e.g., pro rata to zero, the system may try to post everything in the first period instead of spreading it across.

The recommended best practice is to:

  • Keep your historical interval and not adjust or overwrite them in this process
  • It is best you create a new interval starting from the next posting date
  • Adjust useful life correctly by entering the number of remaining periods you want the asset to depreciate over instead of 5 periods.
  • Ensure you set your depreciation key correctly to distribute over remaining life by ensuring the useful life is set in a way that interval starts in the right period. This will spread it over 5 months.
  • Finally, you can verify your data by using the simulate change function which then displays depreciation calculation. If the system still takes all in one month, check if the remaining useful life is calculated correctly in your new interval. Sometimes you need to leave years blank and only set period 5

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: User Provisioning Issue in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

I have did the setp up for BWZ, SE and doing the User provising from AD by creating the Source and Target system in the SAP Cloud Identity Service.

Cannot execute provisioning job in tenant context: <tenant id>
Caused by: Error during execution on behalf of tenant with ID: <tenant id>

Caused by: HTTP operation failed invoking https://<tenant id>.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users?startId=initial&count=100 with statusCode: 401 and body {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"401","detail":"Authentication credentials are invalid or not allowed for this endpoint."}
Caused by: HTTP operation failed invoking https://<tenant id>.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users?startId=initial&count=100 with statusCode: 401, Response: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"401","detail":"Authentication credentials are invalid or not allowed for this endpoint."}

entry.title: Re: Change contact info for S user S00xxxxxxxx
entry.content:
Hi Jinling,

To update the phone number associated with your S-user ID, any Super, Cloud, or User Administrator within your organization can make this change. You can locate the list of Administrators by navigating to the "Users & Contacts - SAP for Me" section in SAP for Me. 

For additional guidance, please refer to KBA 1271545 - How to update SAP for Me and S-user ID settings (phone number, e-mail address, time zone, language, etc) - SAP for Me

If you have further questions or need additional assistance, please don’t hesitate to let me know. 

Best regards,
SAP Support

We have searched for a standard report that would allow us to extract this information but were unable to find one.  I would like to provide additional information regarding what we would like to see in the system:

The structure is based on the S_ALR_87013542 T-code. This report, following a drill-down logic, presents actual values for revenue, COGS, and investments on a location basis. At the same time, it also allows us to view individual detailed data for the specific GL accounts we require. I attached a new attachment. We want to get this kind of a report on Public Cloud S4HANA system.

Could you please advise if such a report exists, or provide guidance on how we can retrieve it?  

Best Regards

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 Beta Program – Call for participation
entry.content: @LAIENPING Regarding your question for adding parameters to the installation to cover additional options from SAP GUI options dialog: We have discussed this internally and came to the conclusion that we cannot add all the parameters to the installation as this would be a lot of effort and come with constant effort to keep this updated. The idea of adding these parameters in the UI was to slightly improve the ease of use for the most important parameters. And then you do not have to run any manual tasks per user anyway already today. See the SAP GUI Installation Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/sap_gui_for_windows/1ebe3120fd734f67afc57b979c3e2d46/b3602f866c204fa68aa2da460011e342.html for information how to add content to an installation package. You can add the registry values to your installation packages and NWSAPSetup will do the rest.

entry.title: Cost price difference (PRD) in transaction MIGO for V-Price material
entry.content:
Dear ladies and gentlemen,

we use a material that is valuated at moving average price. For this material, we want to post a goods receipt with movement type 101 in period 08/2025 in transaction MIGO. SAP gives us error No. M8147 “Account determination for entry OPWE PRD 0001 ___ 3061 not possible”.

We expected SAP to adjust the moving average price. Why does SAP want to post price differences?

Thanks for your support.

Best regards, Marcel Schumacher

entry.title: Automatic Sales Order Creation in SAP S/4HANA from SAP CPQ Quote 2.0 via iFlow
entry.content:
HiHi,

I would like to inquire about the integration capabilities between SAP CPQ and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

After creating a quote in SAP CPQ (Quote 2.0), is there a standard functionality or integration flow available that allows the quote to automatically generate a Sales Order in SAP S/4HANA?

Specifically, we are looking for a way to automate the creation of Sales Orders in S/4HANA without manual intervention once the quote is finalized in CPQ.

Additionally, we would like to confirm whether the standard iFlow "Replicate Quote 2.0 from SAP CPQ to SAP S/4HANA Sales Order" supports this automatic Sales Order creation process. If so, could you please provide documentation or configuration guidance?

https://api.sap.com/integrationflow/Replicate_Quote_2.0_from_SAP_CPQ_to_SAP_S4HANA_Sales_Order

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: SAP Security Forum

Increasing regulatory requirements and the need to secure business-critical SaaS platforms continue to present new challenges for IT security teams. Key topics that companies will need to address in the future regarding SAP security include various aspects of IT cybersecurity. ​

This year’s SAP Security Forum offers practical presentations and interactive sessions that will cover current issues such as infrastructure and communication security, identity and access management, and compliance. ​

​

DSAG Members save 10%. Use the code DSAG_DISC_25 to get 10% off your event ticket. ​

entry.title: Re: In S/4HANA Public Cloud, what is the cds view that co...
entry.content:
Hello @Joey3 

Thank you for your question,

Within the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the cost element category is obtained from the G/L account master through the released CDS views I_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts and I_GLAccountInCompanyCode. As the on-premises FM K_ACCOUNT_ASSIGNMENT_GET is not available in the Cloud. You can refer to this SAP Useful documentation, SAP Help-Released CDS Views – Finance

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to speed up depreciation for an asset's rest life
entry.content: Hi Chris, you really explain it very nice, thank you so much. I think the reason was my depreciation key, I used LINS to run depreciation, but it seems LINS is by year, not month. Then I found if I want the depreciation goes to next 5 months(across year), I need to set a longer useful life like 1 year and 5 periods， then it will not go to only one month.

entry.title: SAP Data and Analytics Forum
entry.content:
The SAP Data and Analytics Forum offers an overview of the latest developments and trends in SAP Data & Analytics. ​

​

On the first day, which is free of charge, the focus will be on presenting the latest trends and developments in Data and Analytics. Participants will gain insights into best practices, new technologies, and applications related to the SAP Business Data Cloud.​

​

The second day, which requires a participation fee, provides the opportunity to deepen expertise through expert sessions and engage in discussions with SAP specialists, trainers, and other participants.​

​

Participants of the 2-day forum will receive a 25% discount on their next certification.​

​

​

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, November 18, 2025 (free virtual first day)​

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite Forum
entry.content:
SAP Integration Suite is an integration platform-as-a-service (iPaaS) that enables the integration of on-premise and cloud-based processes, services, applications, events, and data.​

​

The SAP System Integration Suite Forum provides an opportunity to explore the key features, practical use cases, and benefits of the SAP Systems Integration Suite. Participants can learn about the seamless integration of on-premise and cloud applications and processes using tools and preconfigured content managed by SAP.​

entry.title: Running GK660 Error Running COI Post EC-CS Migration
entry.content:
We are migrating from EC-CS to Group Reporting 2023 private cloud.
System was migrated from EC-CS to GR – we are in process of migration and now testing.

When running the COI, I receive the error COI: Item clearing of consolidation of investments has not been maintained GK660.
1 Any ideas how to resolve?
We would like to configure for rule based consolidation of investments (COI). COI config was not in place during the EC-CS timeframe.

As this is a migration, there is no best practices, therefore I added the investment equity and minority interest attributes, task/method and 11 rules for Investment, equity and Minority interest calculation. There is no config for goodwill. Purchase method only, no equity method. Doc Type 30 configured for COI – left the same from EC-CS (again was never in use).

2. Given the basic COI requirements/config is there a need to complete the COI configuration section?
It’s mostly related to goodwill and equity method – Does it have to be fully configured?

3. I added minimal COI config (methods task doc type) and receive COI consistency check errors:
* Appropriations for goodwill has not been maintained
* Currency translation for goodwill has not been maintained
* Net Income for partial divestures has not been maintained
How do I resolve?
Thanks in advance.
Eyal

entry.title: Re: Request for Actual Cost Report on Existing WBS Elements
entry.content:
Hello @SudeCeper 

Try reviewing these references for more detail.

Analytical Apps for Plan/Actual Analysis,  Project Progress Reporting,  Commercial View ,  Project History PS PUBLIC CLOUD

Custom Analytical Queries

To summarise, the classic on-premise report is not available in public cloud. This is because traditional GUI transaction codes have been replaced with the Fiori apps and CDS-based analytical reports.

In public cloud you can do the following in regards to your use case:

  • Generate project actuals and financial reports through the Project actuals Fiori app.
  • You can display the commercial view of your project reports, measuring your plan vs. actuals using the app.
  • You can display actual line items by drilling down to individual postings at WBS level.
  • You can generate aggregated and detailed project cost report at WBS level.
  • Finally, you can create your own custom analytical query on top of released CDS views.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

// Clear previous chart data

Chart_1.removeDimensions();
Chart_1.removeMeasures();

Chart_1.addDimension("account", Feed.CategoryAxis);

// Optional: filter the dimension to a specific member
// Uncomment the next line if you want to show only "Revenue"

// Add the measure to Y-axis
Chart_1.addMeasure("net_sales", Feed.ValueAxis);

// Refresh the chart to apply changes
Chart_1.update();

​

Auch für das kommende Jahr stehen Reformen, gesetzliche Änderungen und Neuregelungen an, die es in der Personalabrechnung zu beachten gilt. Unsere Sonderveranstaltung bietet einen Überblick über die neuen Funktionalitäten sowie Informationen zu deren Customizing.​

entry.title: Re: error with webservice Procedure in SQL Anywhere
entry.content:
Hm, the log of the requests misses the body of the HTTP POST, methinks. (Not that I do think this would matter.)
Only one of your POST requests ends the URL with '/', does that make a difference?

Otherwise, I have no clue about the issue - I have only ever got the -990 SQLCODE when the certificate was not valid (or the web server used another certificate as I expected...). Of course you could add a CERTIFICATE clause and provide details like sni_hostname if required. But a certificate error would usually affect all HTTP methods and should prevent the server from applying the request at all.

So just a – probably unhelpful – suggestion: You might add the EXCEPTIONS=OFF option (say, via "set 'HTTP(EXCEPTIONS=OFF; VERSION=1.1)'") to your web service procedures as a test. It is usually only required to get the response of HTTP error codes (4xx, 5xx), which do not apply here (as you get a 204) - but maybe this could reveal more information.

entry.title: Re: SAP Adobe form - User unable to copy text
entry.content:
Hi @manohar_penuballi60 ,

How to fix (no OCR needed):

  1. Generate the PDF directly from Adobe Document Services (ADS) (server-side). Don’t “Print to PDF” or use LOCL/SAPWIN—those turn pages into images.

  2. In the form, use real text fields, not images that already contain text (logos/letterheads are fine, but the content must be text objects).

  3. Make sure fonts are embedded on the ADS side.

  4. Check PDF security: allow content copying.

Do those and the output will be a normal, selectable PDF.

Regards,
Sudheer Chunduru

entry.title: Set WarnOnConnection and WarnOnAttach for all users
entry.content:
Hello,

I'd like to configure WarnOnConnection and WarnOnAttach in a "golden image" we build for our users. However, the docs mention that this is should be configured in the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\SAP\SAPGUI Front\SAP Frontend Server\Security key.  This only sets the config for the current user though, and the user we use in the image build is different to the ones our users use. So that key is not useful to us.

The documentation also mentioned the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\software\Wow6432Node\sap\SAPGUI Front\SAP Frontend Server\Scripting  key. I tried creating the keys there and under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\software\Wow6432Node\sap\SAPGUI Front\SAP Frontend Server\Security, but when opening SAP logon, the config was not applied properly.

Is it possible to set this config somewhere in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE?

entry.title: Re: I can't complete GR for shipment because the serial n...
entry.content: The GR is failing with M7092 because the material has a blocking status in the plant that prevents goods movements. You’ll need to update the material status in MM02 Plant Data/Storage 1 view or revise the status definition in OMS9 to allow GR. Also, check if the serial number or sales order has any linked blocks.

entry.title: Re: How to upload an Excel file to backend and display da...
entry.content:
Hi @s_sudhirkumar ,

You can build this quickly in SAP Build Apps without iFlows by accepting CSV (Excel ➜ Save As ➜ .csv). Then, parse and upload all in the app.

Steps

  1. UI

    • Add a File Picker (accept: .csv).

    • Add a Table/Data Grid bound to a page variable, e.g. pageVars.rows.

  2. Parse & preview (File Picker → Files selected)

    • Flow: Open file → Base64 to text → Parse CSV (tick “header row”).

    • Set the output list to pageVars.rows.

    • The table will show the data immediately.

  3. Upload to backend

    • Create a Data resource (OData/REST) via a BTP Destination.

    • If your API supports bulk: HTTP Request (POST) with pageVars.rows.

    • If not: Repeat with pageVars.rows → Create record for each item (optional chunking of ~200 rows + small Delay to avoid timeouts).

  4. Validation & UX

    • Check required headers before upload; map/rename columns if needed.

    • Convert types (NUMBER/DATE) during the loop before calling Create.

    • Show a small progress indicator: uploaded / total.

If you later need native .xlsx, move parsing to a tiny backend (CAP/Function) and keep the same UI.

Regards,
Sudheer Chunduru

entry.title: Re: Cost price difference (PRD) in transaction MIGO for V...
entry.content:
For the error you shared “Account determination for entry OPWE PRD 0001 ___ 3061 not possible”, it means SAP is trying to post a price difference to account 3061 (or whatever is configured for transaction key PRD), but it can’t find a valid G/L account in OBYC for the combination of:

  • Transaction key: PRD (Price Difference)
  • Valuation class
  • Chart of accounts
  • Valuation area (plant)

To answer your question "Why SAP post price differences for MAP?"  SAP posts price differences during GR for MAP materials only if:

  • Invoice price is known at GR time (e.g., via PO condition or info record)
  • GR price ≠ PO price (e.g., PO says ₹100, but GR is posted at ₹120)
  • MAP is not allowed to adjust due to config or timing issues
  • GR is posted in a future period (e.g., 08/2025) and the system cannot update MAP retroactively or the posting logic triggers a price difference due to valuation timing

So go to OBYC, and ensure Transaction key PRD is maintained for your valuation class and plant. This will resolve the error even if SAP insists on posting a price difference

entry.title: Re: Can I extend a certain app? With Clean Core? How?
entry.content:
Hi @AlessandroSpadoni 

Late reply but better late than never. If you cannot analyze a Fiori app but you have web dynpro, transaction code, or maybe even an old-school query. Then you have to start from the business context. What is your "app" about? What's the data, the main object? You can search business object interfaces also on hub.sap.com/api.sap.com. This will give you interface CDS view entities. Knowing the context, you can see if you are able to extend the context in Custom Fields. If not, use the interface CDS and from there you can figure out other CDS involved with your context, and lastly check if they are released with C0 contract. Then proceed to extend as you need. Hope that helps.

Regards

entry.title: Mid-Market SaaS Companies: Running SaaS with Cloud Agility vs. Duct-Tape Systems – Best Practice
entry.content:
Are you a rapidly growing SaaS company looking to streamline your operations and scale efficiently?  

Many believe that SAP is only for large enterprises, focused solely on financials, and prohibitively expensive. Let's dispel those myths! 

Introducing SAP Business Suite for Software Providers SAP Business Suite is designed to support the varied lines of businesses within a SaaS company.  

Whether you are: 

  • A CFO  who needs to manage cash flow, budgets, close the books quickly, and provide real-time business visibility to drive strategic decisions. 
  • A CRO looking to manage your sales pipeline, offer flexible monetization models, and expand into new markets while scaling growth. 
  • A CHRO aiming to manage talent effectively, secure the right skills, and foster ongoing talent development. 
  • A COO striving to automate processes, scale efficiently, and integrate siloed departments. 

SAP Business Suite addresses these and more with its innovative business platform. 

Hear from Software Providers Leveraging SAP Cloud ERP: 

  • Leadsquared has automated subscription services with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. 
  • Seralla harmonized data to support robust lead-to-cash and hire-to-retire processes after a swift migration to the Public Cloud. 

Exciting News: New Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software 

We are thrilled to announce the launch of our Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software. We understand the unique challenges you face: 

  • Data Complexity: Digital offerings require flexible setup, unlike physical products. 
  • Sales System Limitations: Evolving go-to-market strategies demand agile packaging and pricing solutions. 
  • Manual Subscription Processes between sales and provisioning: Decoupled processes lead to errors, customer dissatisfaction, and compliance risks. 
  • Revenue Recognition: Non-integrated processes and manual tasks pose compliance threats. 
  • Subscription Changes: Managing changes during the subscription lifecycle can be cumbersome. 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers addresses these issues with integrated capabilities, allowing you to streamline your operations and accelerate growth.  

The latest SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 includes a predefined SAP Best Practice to speed up your adoption. 

And if you are a service or product-centric company that also sells digital assets – you can utilize this SAP Best Practice as well. 

Interested in Learning More? 

  • For Prospects: Enabling sustainable growth for Software Providers 
  • For Existing SAP Customers:  Scope item details on SAP for Me – SAP Signavio Process Explorer 
  • For Partners and SAP Experts: 
  • Webinar 1: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 1 
  • Webinar 2: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 2 
  • For Scaleups – high-growth companies experiencing rapid expansion, growing 20% or more in employee headcount and turnover over the last three years. - Grow with SAP for Scaleups 

 

Take the Next Step Towards Agility and Growth 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers empowers you to optimize your operations, adapt quickly to market changes, and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Join the C-suite leaders who are embracing SAP's cutting-edge solutions to drive their businesses forward. 

Let's connect and discuss how SAP can transform your SaaS journey!

entry.title: Re: Migration Cockpit: Exclude data from sub structures
entry.content:
Hello Victor,

did you adapt the selection criteria scope in LTMOM? (see screenshot)

The default setting is "Parent and child tables" and means that the selection affects the parent tables. If you left this setting, that could be the cause, why the customers were excluded completely. 

When using the BAdI, the selection criteria scope has the following effect. Only the instances considered relevant in KNB5 are also considered relevant for the parent tables, if you choose "parent and child tables". If you set the selection criteria scope to "Child tables only", then the result set from KNB5 does not propagate upwards.

Please also check 3249988 - Details on selection process - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Direct Transfer - SAP for Me. You will find two documents, which describe the selection process in detail.

With the SKIP rule your requirement cannot be achieved. The SKIP rule exclusively determines "relevant YES/NO" for the entire (!) instance.

I hope this helps to solve your requirement.

Best regards, Kirstin

entry.title: Re: Planning ERP to S4H FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100 Message
entry.content:
When checked in se91 for FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, it shows "&1 &2 &3 &4". This means it’s a generic placeholder message. The actual text is supposed to be filled dynamically at runtime by the program/report (R_FINS_PLANTRANS_CO_ERP_2_S4H). If nothing is passed to those placeholders, you just see the raw &1 &2 &3 &4. So in your case, the report is raising message FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, but it isn’t passing any values into the placeholders. That’s why you don’t see a meaningful explanation.

What you can do is run the report again and then check transaction SLG1 with object FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING. Often the detailed log is written there, even if the message text is empty.

Look in table ACDOCP for your controlling area, version, fiscal year. If no records exist, the message may simply mean “no data selected” or “no data transferred.”

entry.title: Re: SAP Digital Manufacturing (DMC) – QA Environment Setup with a Single SAP Cloud Platform Integrat
entry.content:
Thanks @KatjaHuschle  for this interesting blog that helped us set up SAP DM with multi-backend connectivity in our landscape.

We came across one point that is a severe limitation currently, though: The DM-EWM interfaces delivered with DM CPI standard content are not properly multi-backend enabled as described above. It is not possible to dynamically determine S/4 backend connectivity parameters, so that multi-backend connectivity for EWM interfaces only works if and when:

  • S/4 backends are behind the same Cloud Connector
  • S/4 backends share the same client
  • S/4 backend authentication happens through same RFC user ID and password for all backends.

As S/4 embedded EWM is the default warehousing setup for S/4 going foward, this is an important limitation which I want to mention here in the comments. For those interested in a resolution, please support our Improvement Request for the issue. Thanks!

entry.title: Re: SAP EWM Podcast - Episode 22 - Customs Processing with SAP EWM

entry.title: Re: How to authorize a CF-deployed HTML5 app via a Conten...
entry.content:
Hi @theodore_abitbol ,

another approach you could go with, is to leverage the CDM exposure via the HTML5 Repository, which is possible in the meantime. This capability allows to add CDM definitions, like roles, spaces & pages to the deployment of your HTML5 app to the HTML5 Repository of BTP. Then, instead of consuming the app directly via the "HTML5 Apps" Content Channel, you can create a dedicated Channel (either a manual "Content Provider" or the newly introduced "HTML5 Business Solution"). With this, not only your HTML5 App is being exposed to SAP Build Work Zone, but also the CDM you included into the deployment.

You can check out the following Blog Post which describes this approach (although its focus is mainly the cross-subaccount consumption): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/simplifying-html5-content-consumption-across-subaccounts/ba-p/13758568

Hope this helps.

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 在会计年度末传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
自动传输通过 SAP-S/4HANA 迁移主控室进行数据转移，要创建新的历史数据传输细分，请在"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用中执行以下步骤：

  1. 打开"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用。
  2. 选择用户计划迁移历史数据的公司代码。
  3. 点击"编辑"按钮。
  4. 在"历史数据转移设置"标签页中点击"创建"按钮。
  5. 指定所需参数或确认默认值：
    ○ 输入转移日期：31.12.XXXX
    ○ 转移状态：正在进行（允许其他过账）
    ○ 凭证类型：资产过账（AA）（根据用户的业务需求选择）
    ○ 如果必要，设置指示器以抑制折旧计算。
    ○ 如有必要，输入注释。
  6. 点击"保存"。

 

迁移数据 - 迁移主控室应用

在打开"固定资产 - 过账模板"后，用户必须填写过账代码表。然后，根据用户的业务需求填写累计值表。

通常导致错误的关键考虑事项包括：

  1. 当前财年：这应该反映当前公司代码设置的最高财年。
  2. 分账特定行项目类型：展开第八行以查看并验证分账的特定行项目类型。

 

客户通常希望转移诸如资产价值和累计折旧的数据。
• 当前财年：2025年
• 历史数据转移日期：2024年12月31日

以下是供参考的示例：

  • • 资产编号：12345678
  • 资产购置价值：1000 CNY
  • 累计折旧价值：-200 CNY

 

填写模板的内容如下：

 

还有许多其他分账特定的行项目类型可供选择。用户可以根据实际业务需求进行选择和填写。

 

参考Help Portal 链接：

在会计年度结束日期传输

固定资产 - 过账

entry.title: Re: SAP ui5 apps migration from WEBIDE to BTP BAS while d...

Hi Everyone,

We have identified the solution for this error. The issue was on the backend where the service mentioned below was not activated. After activating the service, the deployment was successful.

Service: ABAP_REPOSITORY_SRV

Thanks:

Bhumesh

entry.title: Re: About use API to create partial billing document base...
entry.content:
Yes this is a current product limitation of the public cloud APIs. The API does not support interactive item selection or quantity adjustment like the Fiori app. SAP’s official guidance is to handle the splitting logic outside SAP (in middleware or custom logic) and then call the API with the desired quantities.

What that means is if you want to bill partial quantities via API, in your middleware or calling system, decide how much of each delivery item should be billed. Construct the API payload with those quantities (instead of the full delivery quantity). Call the API once for each partial billing you want to create. If you want to split one delivery into multiple billing documents (like you can in the app), you must make multiple API calls, each with a subset of items/quantities.

SAP’s documentation on Billing Document Split and Convergence explains that the system can split billing documents based on split‑relevant fields and user settings in the Create Billing Documents app and this section makes clear that the interactive split/merge logic is part of the app, not the API.

entry.title: Re: Notifications from SAP Build Apps to Work Zone
entry.content:
@kazistov_v From a security point of view, it would discouraged to do it with the approach that you are attempting. Why? The logic you are implementing in SAP Build Apps is executed on the front-end. This means, with your approach you are effectively allowing each and every authenticated user to trigger notifications to any arbitrary receiver of your tenant.

The credentials for the notification service (e.g. via a BTP destination), should not be exposed as a dynamic destination to front-end clients (like your Build Apps application deployed to the HTML5 Repository & SAP Build Work Zone). Instead, the logic for creating notifications and interacting with the notification API should only be done from a "backend" application you deploy to SAP BTP to stay in control of which notifications are sent to which user. Unfortunately this would rather fall under the "pro-code" category. One fairly easy approach would be to leverage CAP (SAP Cloud Application Programming Model), which has a plugin that simplifies sending notifications: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/plugins/#notifications

entry.title: External hyperlink to a text field value in Static Adobe Form
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Greetings..!! Would be of great help to find a solution to this.

Requirement: To make the 'Material Number' field clickable in a Static Adobe form, so that when clicked, it takes the user to the product information page. I tried most of the solutions in the help online, but could not get a solution. A solution that i found and tried - but did not work is: After making the Material text fied as 'Rich Text'

var MaterialNumber = this.parent.MATNR.rawValue; // Get the material number value
var targetURL = "https://abcxyz.com/product-details?c=" + MaterialNumber;

// Build minimal XHTML
var xhtml = '<body xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p>' +
'<a href="' + targetURL + '">' + MaterialNumber + '</a>' +
'</p></body>';

// Push the XHTML into the text object
this.value.exData.loadXML(xhtml, /*bValidate*/false, /*bReconcile*/true);

Anything more that needs to be corrected here?

Best Regards,

Satish DK

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 在会计年度期间传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
自动传输通过 SAP-S/4HANA 迁移主控室进行数据转移，要创建新的历史数据传输细分，请在"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用中执行以下步骤：

  1. 打开“对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定”应用。
    2. 选择用户计划迁移历史数据的公司代码。
    3. 点击“编辑”按钮。
    4. 在“历史数据转移设置”标签下，按“创建”按钮。
    5. 指定所需参数或确认默认值：
    ○  转移日期：03.15.XXXX（除了财年最后一天的任何一天）
    ○ 转移状态：进行中（允许其他过账） 凭证类型：资产过账（AA）（根据用户的业务需求选择）
    ○ 如果需要，启用指示器以抑制折旧计算。
    ○ 如有必要，输入注释。
    ○ 点击“保存”。

 

财年内的历史数据转移可以分为两种情况：

情况1

财年：2025 年
历史数据转移日期：03.15.2025
用户希望转移与2025年相关的数据

数据输入所需的表格

在进行历史数据转移时，用户需要填写以下四个表格：过账代码表，过账值表，交易抬头表，和交易项目表。

供参考的示例：

资产编号：12345678

资产购置价值：1000 CNY

过账折旧价值：-200 CNY

交易种类详细信息，请参阅：Asset Accounting: Transaction Types.xlsx (SAP Customer)

 

 

情况2：

财年：2025 年
历史数据转移日期：03.15.2025

用户需要转移2025年及之前年份的数据。

数据输入所需的表格：

过账关键字表 累计值表 过账值表

 

供参考的示例：

资产编号：12345678

资产购置价值：1000 CNY

累计折旧价值：-300 CNY

过账折旧价值：-200 CNY

还有许多其他分账特定的行项目类型可供选择。用户可以根据实际业务需求进行选择和填写。

Help Portal Link:

在会计年度期间传输

固定资产 - 过账

entry.title: Re: BOM Component Validation
entry.content: Sir, now I wrote the logic in user exit PCSD0005. my logic for your reference. IF SY-TCODE EQ 'CS01' OR SY-TCODE EQ 'CS02'. DATA : BEGIN OF TAB, IDNRK TYPE STPOB-IDNRK, END OF TAB. DATA : T_TAB LIKE STANDARD TABLE OF TAB WITH HEADER LINE, WA LIKE LINE OF T_TAB. IMPORT T_TAB FROM MEMORY ID 'ZPP'. MOVE: COMPONENT TO WA-IDNRK. IF T_TAB[] IS NOT INITIAL. LOOP AT T_TAB WHERE IDNRK EQ WA-IDNRK. MESSAGE 'SAME COMPONENT NOT ALLOWED ' TYPE 'E'. ENDLOOP. ENDIF. APPEND WA TO T_TAB. " SORTED BY IDNRK. EXPORT T_TAB TO MEMORY ID 'ZPP'. ENDIF. in cs01 its working perfectly, sir. but in cs02, I pass duplicate value it allows to save. I have alternative BOM also, sir. kindly help me
